item.title: How Open-Source Saves Local Dollars and Builds Local Skill
item.description:
How Open-Source Saves Local Dollars and Builds Local Skill

Why Pay Rent on Software You Already Own?

Every month, folks in Kirksville quietly pay rent on their computers.
A few bucks here for Microsoft 365, a little more for Adobe or some “cloud subscription.”
It doesn’t sound bad—until you realize you’ve been paying for years… and the computer’s still not yours.

That’s not technology. That’s tenancy.

Open-source software—things like Linux, LibreOffice, GIMP, Thunderbird—costs nothing, works for decades, and doesn’t nag you for renewals.
It’s the difference between owning a hammer and renting the handle.
